intro: Agassizia limensis, commonly known as the Limense Agassizia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a velvety texture. Agassizia limensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
